title: Automatically test LFortran on `fpm` packages (status / progress for LFortran)
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/516

Ideally we test on a subset (or all) of packages in the `fpm` registry.

Four separate tests:

* That they parse to AST (and format using `lfortran fmt`) without errors (`lfortran fmt` on every source file)
* Calling `lfortran fmt` on each file and compiling with the default `fpm` compiler and run tests `fpm test` (this ensures that the parser+formatter produces correct code)
* That they transform to ASR without errors (`lfortran --show-asr` on every source file in the correct order)
* That they compile using LLVM without errors (`fpm build`)
* That their tests (`fpm test`) pass when compiled using LFortran

Later we can add the C++ and other backends.

Then we should have a webpage where we list these result in some kind of a table. That way this webpage will serve as the "status of LFortran".

Everything automatically generated.
